Full House Templates
====================



[![](https://github.com/stdword/logseq13-full-house-plugin/raw/main/icon.png?raw=true)](https://github.com/stdword/logseq13-full-house-plugin#readme)



[![](https://camo.githubusercontent.com/6bba904b18a7ba97cc729bc883fb5ba2ddc543aa69f8fba846e429874bb8f555/68747470733a2f2f696d672e736869656c64732e696f2f62616467652f7374617475732d6163746976655f646576656c6f706d656e742d653839383239)](https://github.com/stdword/logseq13-full-house-plugin/releases)
[![](https://camo.githubusercontent.com/8c770bc34326b8abbef9b0344f4db72ebd023b0e3196ba5a5b1aab703886f8db/68747470733a2f2f696d672e736869656c64732e696f2f6769746875622f762f72656c656173652f737464776f72642f6c6f6773657131332d66756c6c2d686f7573652d706c7567696e3f636f6c6f723d353839354339)](https://github.com/stdword/logseq13-full-house-plugin/releases)
[![](https://camo.githubusercontent.com/42ca58fb1481023c889ef05c531bfa62e3815e81039f61fccf30d64c4e7f40ec/68747470733a2f2f696d672e736869656c64732e696f2f6769746875622f646f776e6c6f6164732f737464776f72642f6c6f6773657131332d66756c6c2d686f7573652d706c7567696e2f746f74616c2e7376673f636f6c6f723d443235353834)](https://github.com/stdword/logseq13-full-house-plugin#from-logseq-marketplace-recommended-way)


*A part of the [![](https://github.com/stdword/logseq13-full-house-plugin/raw/main/assets/logseq.png?raw=true)](https://logseq.com) **[Logseq13](https://github.com/search?q=owner%3Astdword+logseq13&type=repositories)** family of plugins*


Summary
-------


Super-configurable, JavaScript-based Logseq Templates for Humans ‚ù§Ô∏è focused on UX and simplicity. This is the missing power in your Logseq knowledge base.


‚öúÔ∏è Features
-----------


* üí™ Rendering templates :) Completely replaces standard templates (can render them all)
* ü§ò Accessing to any meta information: pages titles, blocks properties & content, your graph, etc.
* üìÖ Full support of dates-work: parsing, formatting, shifting
* üëÅ‚Äçüó® Use views (or dynamic templates) to get freshly updated data of your graph
* ‚òòÔ∏è Focusing on UX and simplicity: no more headache on where to add a space to make it work
* üîó Easily make a reference to any journal page: relative to now moment, the current page, specific date or whatever you want
* üëª High configurability with JavaScript logic: vars, conditions, loops (if you know what I mean üòà)
* üõ† A set of handy [template tags](https://stdword.github.io/logseq13-full-house-plugin/#/reference__tags) to work with


Very quick overview
-------------------

### Add logic to templates üìñ



**template¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†‚Üí¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†rendered on page [[Tiago Forte ‚Äî Building a Second Brain]]**  

[![](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/1984175/260448573-8fb8f5d0-c6d1-4759-98bd-891f9f6e5b51.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..imliceN0OGY19_jkkBdV2Y2ma2I2RptPb9ih1xLg9Ok)](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/1984175/260448573-8fb8f5d0-c6d1-4759-98bd-891f9f6e5b51.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..imliceN0OGY19_jkkBdV2Y2ma2I2RptPb9ih1xLg9Ok)
[![](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/1984175/260448588-28f29ada-13b4-485c-956f-667aa50c4d29.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..PIXtnJcLoHP4sbOgDJNdzU7gny8lGJ_3b4LgouNmw-I)](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/1984175/260448588-28f29ada-13b4-485c-956f-667aa50c4d29.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..PIXtnJcLoHP4sbOgDJNdzU7gny8lGJ_3b4LgouNmw-I)




| details ``` - template:: book   - ``{ var [ authors, name ] = c.page.name.split(' ‚Äî ') }``     alias:: ``[name]`` 		author:: ``authors.split(', ').map(ref).join(', ')`` 		category:: [[üìñ/productivity]] 		tags:: book,   - # Book overview   - ...   - rendered with template ¬´``c.template.name``¬ª [‚Üí] (``[c.template.block]``)   - on ``date.now`` ``` |
| --- |


### Use query language to get pages info üìö



**template¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†‚Üí¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†rendered**  

[![](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/1984175/306464522-32bce2af-449e-439b-97cc-01c652d1ba7b.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..vvUDm6HyA4k1HwfSHNg3dcIJq7gNIeuZIzexHQZ9zdw)](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/1984175/306464522-32bce2af-449e-439b-97cc-01c652d1ba7b.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..vvUDm6HyA4k1HwfSHNg3dcIJq7gNIeuZIzexHQZ9zdw)
[![](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/1984175/306466884-119ceed6-01f5-4f6c-b6bc-685d6f84ac28.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..1la_65oVOdTN8nmXw3pVTazaNkhoaVL1QlJn-vNyqc4)](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/1984175/306466884-119ceed6-01f5-4f6c-b6bc-685d6f84ac28.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..1la_65oVOdTN8nmXw3pVTazaNkhoaVL1QlJn-vNyqc4)




| details ``` ``{ var books = query.pages()   .tags('book')   .property('likes')     .value('>', 'üëçüëç')   .property('year')     .value('>', 1994)   .get()   .sorted((p) => [p.props.likes, -p.props.year])   .reverse()   .groupby((p) => p.props.likes)   .forEach(([likes, objs]) => {      outn(likes)      objs.forEach((p) => {         out('   ' + p.props.year)         outn(ref(p.propsRefs.alias.at(-1)))      })   }) }`` ``` |
| --- |


### Mix with standard templates syntax üí•



**template¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†‚Üí¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†rendered**  

[![](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/1984175/260441524-d1724a02-9cb4-464b-8269-c4a2695c94f3.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..K0TuCjXFGY9kDGHZD_PidfQU_Cv7W0AbwG68AYDnCGQ)](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/1984175/260441524-d1724a02-9cb4-464b-8269-c4a2695c94f3.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..K0TuCjXFGY9kDGHZD_PidfQU_Cv7W0AbwG68AYDnCGQ)
[![](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/1984175/260441601-06afde10-ca50-4b4c-9869-a638ee808e40.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..NCOD0g0hcYxKwxtIP6Zdq93PxMXkbCmcOD3itsRSnbA)](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/1984175/260441601-06afde10-ca50-4b4c-9869-a638ee808e40.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..NCOD0g0hcYxKwxtIP6Zdq93PxMXkbCmcOD3itsRSnbA)




| detailsSee details about `fold-page-ref` in [Showroom](https://github.com/stdword/logseq13-full-house-plugin/discussions/7).  ``` - Mixing [./Full House Templates]([[logseq/plugins/Full House Templates]]) and stadard {{renderer(:view,"c.page.namespace.parts[0]")}} templates syntax `'in one template'.bold()`   template:: mix-syntax   - Current page:     - <% current page %>     - `[c.page]`     - `ref(c.page)` or `c.page.name`   - Journal pages:     - <% tomorrow %>     - `[tomorrow]` or `date.tomorrow`   - NLP dates:     - <% in two days %>     - `[date.nlp('in two days')]` or `date.nlp('in two days')` ```    demo1.mp4 |
| --- |

Installation
------------


### From Logseq Marketplace (recommended way):


¬†¬†¬†¬†[![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1984175/223046274-e1b6a192-b7b5-4973-98f4-d9d2ff5ee048.png)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1984175/223046274-e1b6a192-b7b5-4973-98f4-d9d2ff5ee048.png)


* Click ¬´...¬ª and open the ¬´Plugins¬ª section (or press `t p`)
* Click on the ¬´Marketplace¬ª
* On the ¬´Plugins¬ª tab search for ¬´Full House Templates¬ª plugin and click install
* See the [Tutorial](https://stdword.github.io/logseq13-full-house-plugin/#/tutorial) to start using your new superpower :)


### Manual way (in case of any troubles with recommended way)


* Enable ¬´Developer mode¬ª in ¬´...¬ª ‚Üí Settings ‚Üí Advanced
* Download the latest plugin release in a raw .zip archive from [here](https://github.com/stdword/logseq13-full-house-plugin/releases/latest) and unzip it
* Go to the ¬´...¬ª ‚Üí Plugins, click ¬´Load unpacked plugin¬ª and point to the unzipped plugin
* ‚ö†Ô∏è The important point here is: every new plugin release should be updated manually


FAQ
---


### How to fix colors of plugin UI for custom Logseq theme?


1. After the release of Logseq v0.10.5, some issues with plugin UI colors appeared
2. To fix them add following CSS rules to `custom.css`:



```
   :root {
      --fht-footer-text: var(--ls-page-inline-code-color);
      --fht-hightlight: var(--ls-page-mark-bg-color);
      --fht-label-text: var(--ls-page-inline-code-color);
      --fht-active: var(--ls-quaternary-background-color);
      --fht-active-text: var(--ls-secondary-text-color);
      --fht-scrollbar-thumb: color-mix(in srgb, var(--ls-scrollbar-thumb-hover-color) 50%, transparent);
      --fht-scrollbar-thumb-hover: var(--ls-scrollbar-thumb-hover-color);
   }
```

### How to insert frequently used templates rapidly fast?


1. Create the `:command` in `config.edn`.
**Hint**: to perform fast searches, use any command name, but add a special character (e.g. the dot ¬´.¬ª)

```
:commands
 [
 	["psy client session                                             [.]"
         [[:editor/input "{{renderer :template, psy ‚Üí session, :page [[client ]], :online}}" {:backward-pos 13}]] ],
 ]
```
2. Restart Logseq with `‚åòR` or `Ctrl+R`
3. Use `/`-command to insert template with only 3 key presses (`/.‚Ü©Ô∏é`):
[![](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/1984175/283638041-9d5f4314-9c67-4e84-96c6-a45a08d7d8f0.gif?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..e4LlMfjeGlYxDXm855ipm2zJ03L1EEbaXWg_ckZovk0)](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/1984175/283638041-9d5f4314-9c67-4e84-96c6-a45a08d7d8f0.gif?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..e4LlMfjeGlYxDXm855ipm2zJ03L1EEbaXWg_ckZovk0)


### How to use plugin with `:macros`?


**Short answer**: Use the more powerful [`:template-view`](https://stdword.github.io/logseq13-full-house-plugin/#/reference__commands?id=template-view-command) command instead, specially designed for this case.


The only reason to use macros is to reduce the length of text to type-in:



```
{{mymacro ARG1, ARG2}}

```

versus



```
{{renderer :template-view mytemplate, ARG1, ARG2}}

```

But for that purpose it is better to use `:commands` to [make it faster](#how-to-insert-frequently-used-templates-rapidly-fast).


**Long answer** is [here](https://stdword.github.io/logseq13-full-house-plugin/#/alt__macros).


Alternatives
------------




| Plugin | `üèõ Full House` support | Details |
| --- | --- | --- |
| [Dynamic Lookup](https://github.com/peanball/logseq-dynamic-lookup) | ‚úÖ full | [‚Üí](https://stdword.github.io/logseq13-full-house-plugin/#/alternatives?id=dynamic-lookup) |
| [Smart Blocks](https://github.com/sawhney17/logseq-smartblocks) | ‚ö†Ô∏è partial | üö´ buttons, üö´ variables |
| [Power Blocks](https://github.com/hkgnp/logseq-powerblocks-plugin) | ‚ö†Ô∏è partial | üö´ buttons, üö´ variables |


Credits
-------


* *Inspiration*:
	+ [Obsidian Templater](https://github.com/SilentVoid13/Templater) by SilentVoid13
	+ [Logseq SmartBlocks](https://github.com/sawhney17/logseq-smartblocks) by sawhney17
	+ [Logseq Assets Plus](https://github.com/xyhp915/logseq-assets-plus) by xyhp915
* *Tech*:
	+ Based on lightweight embedded JS templating engine: [Eta](https://github.com/eta-dev/eta)
	+ [Day.js](https://day.js.org): a minimalist JavaScript library for dates and times work
	+ [fuzzysort](https://github.com/farzher/fuzzysort): SublimeText-like fuzzy search
* Icon created by [monkik](https://www.flaticon.com/free-icon/web-design_1085802 "Flaticon")
